qas.question: What was the critical lesson Air Staff ignored?

answers.text: Targeting German morale, as Bomber Command would do, was no more successful.
that morale was ever a major consideration for Bomber Command.

qas.question: What did 16 of the Western Air Plans not mention?
When were industrial cities to be targeted?

answers.text: if weather denied strikes on Bomber Command's main concern, oil.

context: Some writers claim the Air Staff ignored a critical lesson, however: British morale did not break. <a0_0>Targeting German morale, as Bomber Command would do, was no more successful.<a0_0/> Aviation strategists dispute <a1_0>that morale was ever a major consideration for Bomber Command.<a1_0/> Throughout 1933–39 none of the 16 Western Air Plans drafted mentioned <a2_0>morale as a target.<a2_0/> The first three directives in 1940 did not mention civilian populations or morale in any way. Morale was not mentioned until the <a3_0>ninth wartime directive on 21 September 1940<a3_0/>. The 10th directive in October 1940 mentioned morale by name. However, industrial cities were only to be targeted <a4_0>if weather denied strikes on Bomber Command's main concern, oil.
